<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Increases in share capital by issuing additional
	securities may be effected through one or a combination of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	in consideration for cash;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	in consideration for assets contributed in kind;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	through an exchange offer or merger;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	by conversion of previously issued debt instruments;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	by exercise of the rights attached to securities giving access to the share capital;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	by capitalization of profits, reserves or share premium; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	subject to certain conditions, by way of offset against debt incurred by us.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Decisions to increase the share capital
	through the capitalization of reserves, profits and/or share premium require shareholders&rsquo; approval at an extraordinary general
	shareholders&rsquo; meeting, acting under the quorum and majority requirements applicable to ordinary shareholders&rsquo; meetings.
	Increases effected by an increase in the nominal value of shares require unanimous approval of the shareholders, unless effected
	by capitalization of reserves, profits or share premium. All other capital increases require shareholders&rsquo; approval at an
	extraordinary general shareholders&rsquo; meeting acting under the regular quorum and majority requirements for such meetings.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Reduction in Share Capital.
</I>
	Pursuant
	to French law, any reduction in our share capital requires shareholders&rsquo; approval at an extraordinary general shareholders&rsquo;
	meeting following the recommendation of our board of directors. The extraordinary general meeting may delegate to the board of
	directors, as applicable, all powers required to implement it. The share capital may be reduced either by decreasing the nominal
	value of the outstanding shares or by reducing the number of outstanding shares. The number of outstanding shares may be reduced
	by the repurchase and cancellation of shares. Holders of each class of shares must be treated equally unless each affected shareholder
	agrees otherwise, depending on the contemplated operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Preferential Subscription Right.
</I>
	According
	to French law, if we issue additional securities for cash, current shareholders will have preferential subscription rights to these
	securities on a
<I>
	pro
</I>
	rata basis. Preferential subscription rights entitle the individual or entity that holds them to subscribe
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	based on the number of shares held by them to the issuance of any securities increasing, or that may result in
	an increase of, our share capital by means of a cash payment or a set-off of cash debts. The preferential subscription rights are
	transferable during the subscription period relating to a particular offering.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The preferential subscription rights with
	respect to any particular offering may be waived at an extraordinary general meeting by a two-thirds vote of our shareholders or
	individually by each shareholder. Our board of directors and our independent auditors are required by French law to present reports
	to the shareholders&rsquo; meeting that specifically address any proposal to waive the preferential subscription rights.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our current shareholders waived their preferential
	subscription rights with respect to this offering at an extraordinary general shareholders&rsquo; general meeting held on December&nbsp;16,
	2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Form, Holding and Transfer of Shares
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Form of Shares.
</I>
	Our By-laws provide
	that our shares are registered or bearer shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Holding of Shares.
</I>
	In accordance
	with French law concerning the &ldquo;dematerialization&rdquo; of securities, the ownership rights of shareholders are represented
	by book entries instead of share certificates. Registered shares are entered into an account maintained by us or by a representative
	appointed by us. We maintain accounts in the name of each shareholder either directly or, at a shareholder&rsquo;s request, through
	such shareholder&rsquo;s accredited intermediary. Each shareholder&rsquo;s account shows the name of the relevant shareholder and
	number of shares held.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 146 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	139
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Ownership of Shares by Non-French Persons.
</I>
	Neither French law nor our By-laws limit the right of non-residents of France or non-French persons to own or, where applicable,
	to vote our securities. Non-residents of France must file an administrative notice with the French authorities in connection with
	a direct or indirect investment in us, including through ownership of ADSs, on the date a binding purchase agreement is executed
	or a tender offer is made public. Under existing administrative rulings the following transactions would require the filing of
	an administrative notice:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	any transaction carried out on our capital by a non-French resident provided that after the transaction the cumulative amount
	of the capital or the voting rights held by non-French residents exceeds 33.33% of our capital or voting rights;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	any transaction mentioned above by a corporation incorporated under French law, more than 33.33% of whose capital or voting
	rights are held by non-French residents;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	any transaction carried out abroad resulting in a change of the controlling shareholder of a corporation incorporated under
	a foreign law that holds a shareholding or voting rights in us if more than 33.3% of our capital or voting rights are held by non-French
	residents;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 20PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	significant loans and guarantees granted or the purchase of patents or licenses, the conclusion of commercial contracts or
	the provision of technical assistance, which confer to our counterparty a
<I>
	de facto
</I>
	controlling position.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Violation of this administrative notice
	requirement is sanctioned by a fine of not more than &euro;750. This amount may be multiplied by five if the violation is made
	by a legal entity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Assignment and Transfer of Shares.
</I>
	They are registered in a share account and transferred by means of a transfer from account to account. We must receive notice of
	any transfer for it to be validly registered in our accounts.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Limitations Affecting Shareholders of a French Company
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Many limitations affect shareholders of
	a French company, the rights of such shareholders being subject to the provisions of French company law. The below list highlights
	certain of the principal limitations, but is not an exhaustive list.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Availability of Preferential Subscription
	Rights
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	While our current shareholders waived their
	preferential subscription rights with respect to this offering at a shareholders&rsquo; general meeting held on December 16, 2014,
	in the future our shareholders will have the preferential subscription rights described under &ldquo;Description of Share Capital&thinsp;&mdash;&thinsp;Key
	Provisions of Our By-laws and French Law Affecting Our Ordinary Shares&thinsp;&mdash;&thinsp;Changes in Share Capital&mdash;Preferential
	Subscription Rights.&rdquo; Under French law, shareholders have preferential rights to subscribe for cash issues of new shares
	or other securities giving rights to acquire additional shares on a pro rata basis. Holders of our securities in the United States
	(which may be in the form of shares or ADSs) may not be able to exercise preferential subscription rights for their securities
	unless a registration statement under the Securities Act is effective with respect to such rights or an exemption from the registration
	requirements imposed by the Securities Act is available. We may, from time to time, issue new shares or other securities giving
	rights to acquire additional shares (such as warrants) at a time when no registration statement is in effect and no Securities
	Act exemption is available. If so, holders of our securities in the United States will be unable to exercise any preferential subscription
	rights and their interests will be diluted. We are under no obligation to file any registration statement in connection with any
	issuance of new shares or other securities. We intend to evaluate at the time of any rights offering the costs and potential liabilities
	associated with registering the rights, as well as the indirect benefits to us of enabling the exercise by holders of shares and
	holders of ADSs in the United States of the subscription rights, and any other factors we consider appropriate at the time, and
	then to make a decision as to whether to register the rights. We cannot assure you that we will file a registration statement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	For holders of our shares in the form of
	ADSs, the Depositary may make these rights or other distributions available to ADS holders. If the depositary does not make the
	rights available to ADS holders and determines that it is impractical to sell the rights, it may allow these rights to lapse. In
	that case the holders will receive no value for them. See &ldquo;Item 12. Description of Securities Other than Equity Securities&mdash;D.
	American Depositary Shares&rdquo; for a detailed explanation of the Depositary&rsquo;s responsibility in connection with a rights
	offering.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 147 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	140
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage148"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Differences in Corporate Law
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The laws applicable to French
<I>
	soci&eacute;t&eacute;s
	anonymes
</I>
	differ from laws applicable to U.S. corporations and their shareholders. Set forth below is a summary of certain differences
	between the provisions of the French Commercial Code applicable to us and the Delaware General Corporation Law relating to shareholders&rsquo;
	rights and protections. This summary is not intended to be a complete discussion of the respective rights and it is qualified in
	its entirety by reference to Delaware law and French law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_31"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	France
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
<B>
	Delaware
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DBE5F1">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Number of Directors
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under French law, a
<I>
	soci&eacute;t&eacute; anonyme
</I>
	must have at least 3 and may have up to 18 directors. The number of directors is fixed by or in the manner provided in the by-laws.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under Delaware law, a corporation must have at least one director and the number of directors shall be fixed by or in the manner provided in the by-laws.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Director Qualifications
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under French law, a corporation may prescribe qualifications for directors under its by-laws, subject to applicable regulations.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under Delaware law, a corporation may prescribe qualifications for directors under its certificate of incorporation or by-laws.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DBE5F1">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Removal of Directors
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under French law, directors may be removed from office, with or without cause, at any shareholders&rsquo; meeting without notice or justification, by a simple majority vote.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under Delaware law, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, directors may be removed from office, with or without cause, by a majority shareholder vote, though in the case of a corporation whose board is classified, shareholders may effect such removal only for cause.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Vacancies on the board of directors
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under French law, vacancies on the board of directors resulting from death or a resignation, provided that at least 3 directors remain in office, may be filled by a majority of the remaining directors pending ratification by the next shareholders&rsquo; meeting.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under Delaware law, vacancies on a corporation&rsquo;s board of directors, including those caused by an increase in the number of directors, may be filled by a majority of the remaining directors.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #DBE5F1">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Annual General Meeting
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under French law, the annual general meeting of shareholders shall be held at such place, on such date and at such time as decided each year by the board of directors and notified to the shareholders in the convening notice of the annual meeting, within 6 months after the close of the relevant fiscal year unless such period is extended by court order.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	Under Delaware law, the annual meeting of shareholders shall be held at such place, on such date and at such time as may be designated from time to time by the board of directors or as provided in the certificate of incorporation or by the by-laws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 148 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	141
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage149"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_32"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	General Meeting
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, general meetings of the shareholders may be called by the board of directors or, failing that, by the statutory auditors, or by a court appointed agent or liquidator in certain circumstances, or by the majority shareholder in capital or voting rights following a public tender offer or exchange offer or the transfer of a controlling block on the date decided by the board of directors or the relevant person.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, special meetings of the shareholders may be called by the board of directors or by such person or persons as may be authorized by the certificate of incorporation or by the by-laws.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Notice of General Meetings
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, for corporations all the shares of which are in registered form, written notice of any meeting of the shareholders must be given at least 15 calendar days before the date of the meeting. When the shareholders&rsquo; meeting cannot deliberate due to the lack of the required quorum, the second meeting must be called at least ten calendar days in advance in the same manner as used for the first notice. The notice shall specify the name of the company, its legal form, share capital, registered office address, registration number with the French Registry of commerce and companies, the place, date, hour and agenda of the meeting and its nature (ordinary or extraordinary meeting).
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or by-laws, written notice of any meeting of the shareholders must be given to each shareholder entitled to vote at the meeting not less than 10 nor more than 60 days before the date of the meeting and shall specify the place, date, hour, and purpose or purposes of the meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Proxy
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, any shareholder may vote by mail or grant a proxy to his/her spouse, his/her partner with whom he/she has entered into a civil union or another shareholder for physical persons or to any person for legal entities. General proxies are not valid and a separate proxy must be provided for each shareholders&rsquo; meeting, unless it concerns an ordinary and an extraordinary meeting held the same day or within the next 15 days, or a consecutive general meeting with the same agenda (in the event the quorum has not been reached).
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, at any meeting of shareholders, a shareholder may designate another person to act for such shareholder by proxy, but no such proxy shall be voted or acted upon after three years from its date, unless the proxy provides for a longer period.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 149 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	142
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage150"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_33"></A>
	Shareholder action by written consent
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, shareholders&rsquo; action by written consent is not permitted in a
<I>
	soci&eacute;t&eacute; anonyme
</I>
	.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, a corporation&rsquo;s certificate of incorporation (1) may permit shareholders to act by written consent if such action is signed by all shareholders, (2) may permit shareholders to act by written consent signed by shareholders having the minimum number of votes that would be necessary to take such action at a meeting or (3) may prohibit actions by written consent.
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_34"></A>
	Preemptive Rights
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, in case of issuance of additional shares or other securities for cash or set-off against cash debts, the existing shareholders have preferential subscription rights to these securities on a
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	basis unless such rights are waived by a two-thirds majority of the votes held by the shareholders present, at&nbsp;the extraordinary meeting deciding or authorizing the capital increase, represented by proxy or voting by mail. In case such rights are not waived by the extraordinary general meeting, each shareholder may individually either exercise, assign or not exercise its preferential rights.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, unless otherwise provided in a corporation&rsquo;s certificate of incorporation, a shareholder does not, by operation of law, possess preemptive rights to subscribe to additional issuances of the corporation&rsquo;s stock.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Sources of Dividends
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Under French law, dividends may only be paid by a
	French
<I>
	soci&eacute;t&eacute; anonyme
</I>
	out of&thinsp; &ldquo;
<I>
	distributable profits
</I>
	,&rdquo; plus any distributable reserves
	and &ldquo;
<I>
	distributable premium
</I>
	&rdquo; that the shareholders decide to make available for distribution, other than those
	reserves that are specifically required by law. &ldquo;
<I>
	Distributable profits
</I>
	&rdquo; consist of the unconsolidated net profits
	of the relevant corporation for each fiscal year, as increased or reduced by any profit or loss carried forward from prior years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&ldquo;
<I>
	Distributable premium
</I>
	&rdquo; refers
	to the contribution paid by the shareholders in addition to the nominal value of their shares for their subscription that the shareholders
	decide to make available for distribution. Except in case of a share capital reduction, no distribution can be made to the shareholders
	when the net equity is, or would become, lower than the amount of the share capital plus the reserves which cannot be distributed
	in accordance with the law.
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, dividends may be paid by a Delaware corporation either out of&thinsp; (1) surplus or (2) in case there is no surplus, out of its net profits for the fiscal year in which the dividend is declared and/or the preceding fiscal year, except when the capital is diminished by depreciation in the value of its property, or by losses, or otherwise, to an amount less than the aggregate amount of capital represented by issued and outstanding stock having a preference on the distribution of assets.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 150 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	143
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_35"></A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Repurchase of Shares
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Under French law, a private corporation (being specified
	that the company will not qualify as a public corporation for French law purposes for so long as it shall be listed in the United
	States only) may acquire its own shares for the following purposes only:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
	decrease its share capital, provided that such decision is not driven by losses and that a purchase offer is made to all shareholders
	on a
<I>
	pro rata
</I>
	basis, with the approval of the shareholders at the extraordinary general meeting deciding the capital reduction;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;with
	a view to distributing within one year of their repurchase the relevant shares to employees, corporate officers and directors under
	a profit-sharing or equity incentive plan;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, a corporation may generally redeem or repurchase shares of its stock unless the capital of the corporation is impaired or such redemption or repurchase would impair the capital of the corporation.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to
	sell the relevant shares to any shareholders willing to purchase them as part of a process organized by the corporation within
	five years of their repurchase; or
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;within
	the limit of 5% of its issued share capital, in payment or in exchange for assets acquired by the corporation within two years
	of their repurchase.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	No such repurchase of shares may result in the company holding,
	directly or through a person acting on its behalf, more than 10% of its issued share capital.
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 151 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	144
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_36"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Liability of Directors and Officers
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, the by-laws may not include any provisions limiting the liability of directors.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Under Delaware law, a corporation&rsquo;s certificate
	of incorporation may include a provision eliminating or limiting the personal liability of a director to the corporation and its
	shareholders for damages arising from a breach of fiduciary duty as a director. However, no provision can limit the liability of
	a director for: any breach of the director&rsquo;s duty of loyalty to the corporation or its shareholders;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;acts
	or omissions not in good faith or that involve intentional misconduct or a knowing violation of law;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;intentional
	or negligent payment of unlawful dividends or stock purchases or redemptions; or
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any
	transaction from which the director derives an improper personal benefit.&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Voting Rights
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	French law provides that, unless otherwise provided in the by-laws, each shareholder is entitled to one vote for each share of capital stock held by such shareholder.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Delaware law provides that, unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, each shareholder is entitled to one vote for each share of capital stock held by such shareholder.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Shareholder Vote on Certain Transactions
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Generally, under French law, completion of a merger,
	dissolution, sale, lease or exchange of all or substantially all of a corporation&rsquo;s assets requires:
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_37"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;completion
	of a merger requires the approval of the board of directors and the approval by a two-third majority of the votes held by the shareholders
	present, represented by proxy or voting by mail at the relevant meeting or, in the case of a merger with a non-EU company, approval
	of all shareholders of the corporation may be required, depending on the nationality of the concerned companies and therefore the
	applicable laws;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;dissolution
	requires the approval by a two-third majority of the votes held by the shareholders present, represented by proxy or voting by
	mail at the relevant meeting; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;sale,
	lease or exchange of all or substantially all of a corporation&rsquo;s assets requires the approval by a two-third majority of
	the votes held by the shareholders present, represented by proxy or voting by mail at the relevant meeting if such operation modifies
	the corporate purpose set forth in the By-laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Generally, under Delaware law, unless the certificate
	of incorporation provides for the vote of a larger portion of the stock, completion of a merger, consolidation, sale, lease or
	exchange of all or substantially all of a corporation&rsquo;s assets or dissolution requires:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
	approval of the board of directors; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;approval
	by the vote of the holders of a majority of the outstanding stock or, if the certificate of incorporation provides for more or
	less than one vote per share, a majority of the votes of the outstanding stock of a corporation entitled to vote on the matter.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 152 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	145
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_38"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 23%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Dissent or Dissenters&rsquo; Appraisal Rights
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	French law does not provide for any such right but provides that a merger is subject to shareholders&rsquo; approval by a two-thirds majority vote as stated above.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Under Delaware law, a holder of shares of any class
	or series has the right, in specified circumstances, to dissent from a merger or consolidation by demanding payment in cash for
	the shareholder&rsquo;s shares equal to the fair value of those shares, as determined by the Delaware Chancery Court in an action
	timely brought by the corporation or a dissenting shareholder. Delaware law grants these appraisal rights only in the case of mergers
	or consolidations and not in the case of a sale or transfer of assets or a purchase of assets for stock. Further, no appraisal
	rights are available for shares of any class or series that is listed on a national securities exchange or held of record by more
	than 2,000 shareholders, unless the agreement of merger or consolidation requires the holders to accept for their shares anything
	other than:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares
	of stock of the surviving corporation;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;shares
	of stock of another corporation that are either listed on a national securities exchange or held of record by more than 2,000 shareholders;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;cash
	in lieu of fractional shares of the stock described in the two preceding bullet points; or
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any
	combination of the above.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	In addition, appraisal rights are not available to
	holders of shares of the surviving corporation in specified mergers that do not require the vote of the shareholders of the surviving
	corporation.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 153 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	146
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Standard of Conduct for Directors
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	French law does not contain specific provisions setting forth the standard of conduct of a director. However, directors have a duty to act without self-interest, on a well-informed basis and they cannot make any decision against a corporation&rsquo;s corporate interest (
<I>
	int&eacute;r&ecirc;t social
</I>
	).
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Delaware law does not contain specific provisions setting forth the standard of conduct of a director. The scope of the fiduciary duties of directors is generally determined by the courts of the State of Delaware. In general, directors have a duty to act without self-interest, on a well-informed basis and in a manner they reasonably believe to be in the best interest of the shareholders.
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_40"></A>
	Shareholder Suits
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	French law provides that a shareholder, or a group of shareholders,
	may initiate a legal action to seek indemnification from the directors of a corporation in the corporation&rsquo;s interest if
	it fails to bring such legal action itself. If so, any damages awarded by the court are paid to the corporation and any legal fees
	relating to such action are borne by the relevant shareholder or the group of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The plaintiff must remain a shareholder through the duration
	of the legal action.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	A shareholder may alternatively or cumulatively bring individual
	legal action against the directors, provided he has suffered distinct damages from those suffered by the corporation. In this case,
	any damages awarded by the court are paid to the relevant shareholder.
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Under Delaware law, a shareholder may initiate a derivative
	action to enforce a right of a corporation if the corporation fails to enforce the right itself. The complaint must:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;state
	that the plaintiff was a shareholder at the time of the transaction of which the plaintiff complains or that the plaintiff&rsquo;s
	shares thereafter devolved on the plaintiff by operation of law; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;allege
	with particularity the efforts made by the plaintiff to obtain the action the plaintiff desires from the directors and the reasons
	for the plaintiff&rsquo;s failure to obtain the action; or
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;state
	the reasons for not making the effort.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Additionally, the plaintiff must remain a shareholder through
	the duration of the derivative suit. The action will not be dismissed or compromised without the approval of the Delaware Court
	of Chancery.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22%; BORDER-BOTTOM: WHITE 1PT SOLID; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	France
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38%; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<B>
	Delaware
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Amendment of Certificate of Incorporation
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, there is no certificate of incorporation
<I>
	per se
</I>
	. The equivalent of the certificate of incorporation is called &ldquo;
<I>
	extrait K-bis
</I>
	&rdquo; and reflects all the significant information with regards to a French company, such as its name, date of registration, identification number, form, share capital, registered office, governance and administration,
<I>
	etc
</I>
	. Any changes of the By-laws, or in the situation of the company as reflected in the extrait K-bis, shall be registered with the competent Registry of Commerce and Companies on the French territory.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	Under Delaware law, generally a corporation may amend
	its certificate of incorporation if:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;its
	board of directors has adopted a resolution setting forth the amendment proposed and declared its advisability; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.2IN 0PT 20PT; TEXT-INDENT: -19PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;&#9;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
	amendment is adopted by the affirmative votes of a majority (or greater percentage as may be specified by the corporation) of
	the outstanding shares entitled to vote on the amendment and a majority (or greater percentage as may be specified by the corporation)
	of the outstanding shares of each class or series of stock, if any, entitled to vote on the amendment as a class or series.&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Amendment of By-laws
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under French law, by-laws may only be adopted or amended at extraordinary shareholders&rsquo; meetings.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-TOP: 6PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	Under Delaware law, the shareholders entitled to vote have the power to adopt, amend or repeal by-laws. A corporation may also confer, in its certificate of incorporation, that power upon the board of directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 154 -->

	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	147
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">

	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
