	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Advanced Accelerator Applications S.A.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-24">
</A>
	3.24.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sales
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sales are recognized when the following
	conditions are satisfied:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	There is an agreement between the parties;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	the goods have been delivered or the services
	rendered (i.e. the transfer of risks and benefits of ownership has taken place);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	the price is fixed or can be reliably measured;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	it is probable that future economic benefits
	from the transaction will flow to the Group as required under IAS 18.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Rebates and discounts granted to customers
	are deducted from the corresponding sales revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Certain products and product candidates
	sold by AAA have a very short shelf life. In particular, the shelf life of F18 PET products and product candidates does not exceed
	10 hours. As a result, these products and product candidates are manufactured in batch processes overnight and delivered to customers,
	generally located close to the production site, in the morning. The transfer of ownership occurs when the batch is delivered to
	the customer, which is also the date on which the sales revenue is recognized in the statement of income.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group entered into an agreement for
	the production of AV-45 with the Eli Lilly group in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For each site where AV-45 is produced, AAA
	is committed under the agreement to purchase the specialized production equipment (from Eli Lilly for certain designated sites
	or from a third party supplier for other sites) and to manage its installation and commissioning. The cost of all associated equipment
	and expenses are charged back under the contract to Eli Lilly when the site is commissioned. The related revenue recognition is
	spread over the term of the contract under IFRIC18 as the Group considers that it represents a transfer of assets from a customer
	and that the related revenue transfer is an integral part of the AV-45 supply agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The agreement also defines the sale and
	invoicing of trial batches as well as the sale and invoicing of doses during the distribution phase. These latter sales are recognized
	on product delivery similarly to other products manufactured and sold by the Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-25">
</A>
	3.25.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Raw materials and other consumables used
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This line item includes raw materials consumed,
	transport, sales royalties and licensing fees, and purchases of pharmaceutical products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-26">
</A>
	3.26.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Research and development expenditure
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Expenditure incurred during research is
	expensed as incurred (see note 4.6).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Expenditure incurred during development
	is capitalized as intangible assets under the conditions described in note 3.11.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-27">
</A>
	3.27.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating Result
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Net operating income consists of sales less
	the cost of raw materials and other consumables used and other operating expenses. Operating expenses mainly include personnel
	costs, other operating income and expenses, depreciation and amortization expense and impairment charges.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Net operating income includes the impact
	of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	gains and losses on disposal of non-current
	assets;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-28">
</A>
	3.28.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Finance income and costs
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Finance costs consist of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	interest expenses (gross finance cost,
	which includes financial expenses, issuance costs and foreign exchange losses on financial liabilities) on Group financial debt
	consisting of loans and other financial liabilities (in particular overdrafts and finance lease liabilities);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	unwinding of the discounting of provisions;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	impact on loss from shareholdings in non-consolidated
	investments (impairment, loss on disposal);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	the loss in the fair value of liabilities
	to former owners of subsidiaries (contingent consideration);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>

	exchange rate losses.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Finance income consists of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	other financial income;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	impact on profit from shareholdings in
	non-consolidated investments (dividends, profit on disposal) and income from short-term investments;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	exchange rate gains;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	the gain in the fair value of liabilities
	to former owners of subsidiaries (contingent consideration);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	exchange gains on financial liabilities
	on Group financial debt consisting of loans and other financial liabilities (in particular overdrafts and finance lease liabilities).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-29">
</A>
	3.29.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Income taxes
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Income taxes consist of current
	and deferred tax. Income tax is recognized in the statement of income except when it relates to items recognized directly in other
	comprehensive income or in equity, in which case it is recognized in other comprehensive income or in equity, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Current tax is the expected tax
	payable on the taxable income of a period, using tax rates enacted or substantively enacted at the reporting date, and any adjustment
	to tax payable from previous years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Deferred tax is determined using
	the liability method, for temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting
	purposes and the amounts used for taxation purposes. The following temporary differences are not provided for: (i) goodwill not
	deductible for tax purposes, (ii) differences relating to investments in subsidiaries to the extent that it is probable that they
	will not reverse in the foreseeable future and (iii) the initial recognition of assets or liabilities in a transaction that is
	not a business combination and that affects neither accounting nor taxable profit. The measurement of deferred tax assets and liabilities
	is based on the judgment of the Group as to how it will recover the carrying amount of assets and liabilities, using tax rates
	enacted or substantively enacted at the reporting date. Deferred tax is measured at the tax rates that are expected to be applied
	to temporary differences when they reverse or are offset.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Deferred tax assets and liabilities
	are offset when there is a legally enforceable right to offset current tax assets and liabilities and when they relate to income
	tax levied by the same tax jurisdiction and the Group intends to settle its current tax assets and liabilities on a net basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A deferred tax asset net of any
	deferred tax liabilities that may be offset is recognized only to the extent that it is probable that the Group will have sufficient
	future taxable profits to recover it. A deferred tax asset is reduced to the extent that it is no longer probable that sufficient
	future taxable profits will be available.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0.05IN 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 200 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	30
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage201"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_NOTES" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Advanced Accelerator Applications S.A.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-30">
</A>
	3.30.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Statement of cash flows
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The consolidated statement of cash flows
	is prepared using the indirect method. It distinguishes between cash flows from operating, investing and financing activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating activities are the principal activities
	that generate the income of the entity and all other activities that do not meet the definition as investing or financing activities.
	Cash flows from operating activities are obtained by adjusting net income for changes in working capital, items that do not affect
	cash (depreciation and amortization, impairment charges etc.), gains and losses on disposal of non-current assets, calculated expenses,
	etc.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash flows from investing activities are
	the cash flows from the acquisition and disposal of non-current assets and other investments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Financing activities are operations that
	result from changes in the volume and composition of capital contributions and from changes in borrowings. Increases in share capital,
	payments of deferred and contingent liabilities to former owner of acquired subsidiaries, transaction with NCI, new borrowings
	and related repayments are financing activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Increases and decreases in assets and liabilities
	without effect on cash are eliminated. It follows that lease payments for assets being financed with a finance lease are not included
	in investing activities while the reduction in liabilities under finance leases is included in the loan repayments for the period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F3-31">
</A>
	3.31.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Earnings per share
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group presents basic earnings per share
	and diluted earnings per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Basic and diluted earnings per share are
	calculated under IAS 33.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Basic earnings per share are calculated
	by dividing the Group share of net income by the average weighted number of shares outstanding during the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Diluted earnings per share are calculated
	by dividing the adjusted Group share of net income for the year by the average weighted number of ordinary shares outstanding adjusted
	for the effect of all dilutive potential ordinary shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: SMALL-CAPS BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F4">
</A>
	4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Notes to the consolidated statement of income
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F4-1">
</A>
	4.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating segments and entity-wide disclosures
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Operating segment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In compliance with IFRS 8
<I>
	Operating Segments
</I>
	,
	the segment information is based on internal management reports used by the Board of Directors (the chief operating decision maker
	of the Group) to review the performance of the business. There is only one operating segment in the Group and its performance is
	shown in the consolidated statement of income.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Entity-wide disclosures
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other required entity-wide disclosures in
	accordance with IFRS 8 are presented below.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Sales by product category
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT; TEXT-INDENT: 8PT">
	SPECT
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PT">

<B>

	sales and non-current assets by country. In presenting the following information, sales disclosures are based on the location of
	customers and asset disclosures on the location of the sites of Group entities.

	bonus paid to certain members of the management for an amount of &euro;1.2 million (see note 8).

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The expense recognized for share-based payments
	amounted to &euro;1.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The expenses for the years 2014 and 2013 were &euro;2.3
	million and &euro;2.3 million respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 9PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F4-3">
</A>
	4.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Share-based payments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F4-3-1">
</A>
	4.3.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Restricted (free) share plans
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Share-based payments include restricted
	(free) share plans for Group management. The fair value of the share grants was determined by reference to the subscription price
	of share capital increases carried out closest to the dates of these free share grants.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	There are no vesting conditions, except
	for a service condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On November 10, 2015. the day of the IPO
	pricing, the Group adopted a new Stock Option Plan, under which equity-settled stock options have been granted to employees. Movements
	in stock options over ordinary shares in the Company were as follows
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The options outstanding at December 31,
	2015 had an exercise price of $8.00 (&euro;7.45 based on an exchange rate at the grant date) and a weighted average remaining contractual
	life of 9.86 years. No options were exercisable at December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of options granted during
	the year was estimated using the Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following significant assumptions:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Volatility was determined by considering
	the volatility of a group of comparable listed companies over the period commensurate with the expected term.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The options are not subject to any performance
	conditions and normally vest following the third anniversary of the date of grant provided that the option holder remains a Director
	or employee of the Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of the Stock Option plan
	was estimated at &euro;13.7 million. This expense will be recorded gradually over the 3-year vesting period in accordance with
	IFRS 2. An expense of &euro;603 thousand was recognized in the consolidated statement of income (loss) for the year ended December
	31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the year, the Company granted 225,000
	warrants to six Board members for consideration of &euro;0.80 per warrant (&euro;180,000 in aggregate). The warrants are exercisable
	immediately following the grant date and lapse after a period of 18 months.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	ordinary shares in the Company in the year were as follows:

	million for the year ended December 31, 2015. The respective figures for the years 2014 and 2013 were &euro;4.23 million and &euro;3.98
	million.

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Contribution sur la Valeur Ajout&eacute;e des Entreprises (&ldquo;CVAE&rdquo;) and the Imposta
	Regionale sulle Attivita Produttive (&ldquo;IRAP&rdquo;) are French and Italian local taxes, respectively. They are determined
	using defined elements of revenues and expenses and are considered to be income taxes in accordance with IAS 12.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred tax assets on carry forward losses
	have been recognised only to the extent of the available taxable temporary differences for each taxable entity.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Deferred tax assets and tax liabilities
	are offset when they concern the same taxable entity (or group of entities) and the entity has a legally enforceable right to settle
	current tax assets and liabilities in the consolidated statement of financial position
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

	As of 31 December 2015, the Group had available
	tax loss carry forwards for which no deferred tax asset was recognized due to the early stage of development of the entities in
	these countries, and because these entities are not likely to have taxable income in the foreseeable future:
</P>

<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F5-2">
</A>
	5.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Acquisition of business for the year 2014
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Acquisition of Imaging Equipment Ltd.
	(IEL)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On February 14, 2014, the Group obtained
	control of Imaging Equipment Limited (IEL) by acquiring 100% of its issued share capital. IEL is a privately-held UK distributor
	of nuclear medicine products. This acquisition contributes to AAA&rsquo;s international expansion by providing a direct distribution
	presence in the UK and Ireland as well as an established sales and marketing platform.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The valuation technique used for measuring
	the acquired customer relationship was the multi-period excess earnings method. There was no other significant tangible or intangible
	asset.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Following this acquisition, negative Goodwill
	of &euro; 94 thousand was recognized in other operating income in the consolidated income statement of the Group at December 31,
	2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	38
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage209"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#DP65110_20F_HTM_NOTES" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Advanced Accelerator Applications S.A.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of the 294,743 ordinary shares
	issued as part of the consideration paid for IEL (&euro; 1,474 thousand) was assessed on the basis of a capital increase of new
	shares that were issued on the same day as the IEL acquisition. Shareholders and new investors paid a total of &euro; 41 million
	for these shares i.e. a price of &euro;5 per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	IEL contributed &euro; 9.6 million to the
	Group&rsquo;s revenue and &euro; 0.4 million to the Group&rsquo;s income for the period between the date of acquisition and the
	December 31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	If the acquisition of IEL had been completed
	on the first day of the financial year 2014, group revenues for the year ended December 31, 2014 would have been &euro; 71.9 million
	(instead of &euro;69.9 million) and the contribution to the Group&rsquo;s income would have been &euro; (0.6) million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Acquisition of the SteriPet business
	of GE Healthcare S.r.L in Italy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On September 15, 2014, AAA Italy acquired
	from GE Healthcare S.r.L. its FDG-PET business. This acquisition includes the SteriPET&reg; (FDG) Marketing Licence. This acquisition,
	consisting of certain assets, liabilities and legal relationships, for the most part customer relationships, allows AAA Italy to
	strengthen its commercial operations and to become the leader in this business in Italy. The transaction consists of cash payments
	of up to &euro;697 thousand within 12 months of execution of the contract and royalty payments on sales to former SteriPET&reg;
	customers of GE Healthcare Italy. The royalties will be due on sales between September 2015 and September 2017. The costs related
	to this acquisition are not significant and were expensed as incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	(1)
	Contingent consideration
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #4F81BD">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has agreed to pay the selling
	shareholders a contingent consideration in cash. The amount has been estimated at acquisition date as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&euro;200 thousand paid on September 15,
	2015 provided that one of the suppliers is still regularly supplying. The contribution to the contingent consideration transferred
	is &euro; 196 thousand which corresponds to the present value of &euro;200 thousand discounted at 3% from the payment date.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&euro;564 thousand of estimated royalties
	to be paid on future net sales to existing customers between September 15, 2015 and September 15, 2017.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The valuation technique used for measuring
	the acquired customer relationship was the multi-period excess earnings method. There was no other significant tangible or intangible
	asset.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Following this acquisition, Goodwill of
	&euro;200 thousand was recognized at December 31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The goodwill is entirely attributable to
	AAA Italy, which is considered as a separate CGU (cash generating unit) within the Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This acquisition had no significant impact
	on the Group&rsquo;s revenues and income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Patents/Licenses primarily consist of intellectual
	property relating to the therapy product candidate FabOvar which was acquired in 2011 for an amount of &euro;8 million with a carrying
	amount of &euro;4.8 million at December 31, 2015 (&euro;5.6 million at December 31, 2014 and &euro;6.4million at December 31, 2013).
	The purchase agreement also provides for a variable payment based on a percentage of future sales until the legal protection of
	the patent expires in 2028. Acquired IPR&amp;D for &euro;17.1 million as at December 31, 2015 (&euro;16.1 million as at December
	31, 2014 and &euro;14.7 million as at December 31, 2013) results from the acquisitions of Atreus Pharmaceuticals Corporation and
	Advanced Accelerator Applications USA, Inc. in 2010.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Goodwill is stable with a total amount of
	&euro; 22.6 million at December 2015 compared to &euro; 21.3 million at December 31, 2014 and &euro; 21.2 million at December 31,
	2013. The variation in 2015 results from an increase of goodwill due to the translation differences on the USD / ILS denominated
	goodwill for &euro; 1.3 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In 2014, the stability resulted from an
	increase of goodwill due to the acquisition of the SteriPet business of GE Healthcare and to the translation differences on the
	USD / CAD denominated goodwill compensated by the &euro; 0.8 million additional impairment loss recognized on the Portugal goodwill.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The recoverable amount of CGUs was
	calculated on the basis of their value in use. The value in use is the present value of the estimated future cash flows from
	the continued use of the asset. The value in use is determined on the basis of estimated cash flows using budgets and
	business plans over periods from 5 to 10 years; subsequent cash flows are extrapolated by applying a constant rate of
	positive or negative growth, and discounted to present value. The discount
	rate used reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset (or CGU).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 211 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The budgeted EBITDA increase
	mainly results from the forecasted sales of Lutathera, which is expected to obtain FDA approval and EMA marketing authorization
	in 2017. This product candidate is currently in Phase 3 development and as a result an extended forecast period of 8 to 10 years
	has been retained. For the U.S. CGU, the forecasted sales are based entirely on Lutathera.
</FONT>
</TD>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Concerning Canada, the
	future EBITDA growth is also based on the sale of Annexin V-128, a product candidate currently under development and currently
	in Phase 1/2 trials.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Following these tests,
	an impairment loss of &euro;1.0 million was recognized on the goodwill of Portugal CGU in 2013, and of &euro;0.8 million in 2014.
	An additional impairment loss of &euro; 1.3 million has been attributed to tangible assets of Portugal in 2014, and of &euro;0.46
	million in 2015. The loss mainly results from the downward revision of forecasted sales and EBITDA as a result of a new competitor
	who entered the market.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	(1)
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The recoverable amount of Portugal CGUs
	is equal to its carrying amount after recognition of impairment loss. Therefore any adverse movement in a key assumption would
	lead to further
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	impairment.
</FONT>
</TD>

	by the Group to hedge its exposure to foreign exchange risks arising from the cash received in dollars following the IPO. These
	derivatives assets are measured at fair value subsequent to their initial recognition and any change in the fair value is recorded
	through the income statement.&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F5-10">
</A>
	5.10.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Equity
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s policy is to manage its
	capital to ensure to be able to continue as a going concern while maximizing the return to shareholders through the optimization
	of the debt and equity balance. The capital structure consists of financial liabilities as detailed in Notes 5.13 offset by cash
	and bank balances and equity (comprising issued capital, reserves and retained earnings). The Group is not subject to any externally
	imposed capital requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2015, the share capital
	consists of 78,556,211 fully paid-up ordinary shares, with a nominal value of &euro;0.10 per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Increase of share capital
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The increases in share capital which occurred
	from January 1, 2015 through December 31, 2015 are described follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_96"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="2" STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 38.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Initial Public Offering (IPO)
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	AAA completed an IPO of 4,688,000
	American Depositary Shares (&ldquo;ADS&rdquo;) representing 9,376,000 ordinary shares at a price of $16.00 (&euro;14.9) per
	ADS (each ADS represents 2 ordinary shares). The ADS have been listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market on and started
	trading on November 11, 2015 under the ticker &ldquo;AAAP&rdquo;. The overallotment option (Greenshoe) of 15% was also used
	immediately by the Underwriters and an additional 1,406,400 shares or 703,200 ADS were issued at the same price of US$16.00
	(&euro;14.9) per ADS.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2014, the share capital
	consisted of 63,229,041 fully paid-up ordinary shares, with a nominal value of &euro;0.10 per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The increases in share capital which occurred
	from January 1, 2014 through December 31, 2014 are described follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, and
	2014 there are no free shares vested but not yet issued included in the average number of shares outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the year ended December 31, 2013, the
	average number of shares outstanding includes 241,114 shares related to the contingent consideration for the acquisition of Atreus
	Pharmaceuticals Corporation in 2010 (as all conditions were met at December 31, 2013) and 197,500 shares vested but not yet issued
	by the Company:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 28.35PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
	&middot;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	As at December 31, 2013, the contingent
	consideration recognized as an equity instrument provides for the issuance in 2014 of 241,114 shares to the former owners of Atreus
	Pharmaceuticals Corporation. The fair value of the contingent consideration was estimated at the acquisition of Atreus Pharmaceuticals
	Corporation in 2010 based on the fair value of AAA shares at the acquisition date, i.e., &euro;2.50 per share, representing contingent
	consideration at December 31, 2013 of &euro;603,000 and a fixed number of shares.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	A total of 197,500 free shares granted
	to employees in November 2011 were fully vested at December 31, 2013 but had not yet been issued, at the request of the employees.
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Free shares and options granted to employees
	and warrants to six Board members but not yet vested and/or exercised at December 31, 2015, December 31, 2014 and December 31,
	2013 are not considered for diluted earnings per share calculation as they would reduce loss per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.75PT">
<A NAME="DP65110_20F_HTM_F5-11">
</A>
	5.11.&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Non-controlling interests
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 11PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Group
	has no non-controlling interest at the end of the periods as a result of the following transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On November 10, 2014, the Group acquired
	the remaining 49.9% non-controlling interest in AAA Germany GmbH (the former Umbra Medical AG) as explained in notes 2.1.2. The
	method of consolidation remains unchanged for this shareholding.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On December 18, 2014, the Group acquired
	the remaining 49.9% non-controlling interest in Atreus Pharmaceuticals Corporation as explained in notes 2.1.2. The method of consolidation
	remains unchanged for these shareholding.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following table summarizes the effect
	of these acquisitions on the Group Equity in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Provisions for decommissioning PET production
	sites
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2015, these provisions amounted
	to &euro;7.2 million compared with &euro;6.9 million at December 31, 2014 and &euro;5.1 million in 2013. The increase of approximately
	&euro;0.3 million between 2015 and 2014 relates to the unwinding of the discounting of the obligation. The increase of approximately
	&euro;1.8 million between 2013 and 2014 is due to the unwinding of the discounting of the obligation for &euro; 0.3 million and
	the installation of three new Cyclotrons in Germany and France in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Decommissioning costs for a typical site
	have been estimated by an independent expert. From this base cost and with annual inflation assumed to be 2%, the Group has estimated
	the expected decommissioning costs at the forecast date for each site concerned. These costs are then discounted to the reporting
	date. The discount rate applied is 4.57% (same as at December 31, 2014 and 2013). A change (decrease or increase) of 1 percentage
	point in this rate would lead to a respective increase or decrease in the provision of &euro; 0.2 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 221 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	51
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</A>

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Advanced Accelerator Applications S.A.
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Retirement Indemnities and other employee
	benefits
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The
	Group has three main employee defined benefit obligations in France, Italy and Switzerland which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	are
	subject to annual actuarial measurement, using the projected credit unit method. The assets and liabilities recognised in the balance
	sheet at 31 December for these defined benefit obligations are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The plan assets concern only the Swiss defined
	benefit plan. The plan assets are primarily held within instruments with quoted market prices in an active market such as Equity
	securities and Debt securities, with the exception of the property that includes some direct investment in real estate.
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Advanced Accelerator Applications S.A.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
<I>
	In Switzerland
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Group jointly operates with the employees
	a retirement foundation in Switzerland. The assets and liabilities of the retirement foundation are held separately from the Group.
	This foundation covers all the employees in Switzerland and provides benefits on a defined contribution basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Each employee has a retirement account to which
	the employee and the Group contribute at a rate set out in the foundation rules based on a percentage of salary. Every year, the
	foundation decides the level of interest, if any, to apply to retirement accounts based on the agreed policy. At retirement, employees
	can elect to withdraw all or part of their balances of their retirement account, failing which the retirement account is converted
	into annuities at pre-defined conversion rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Because the foundation Board is expected to
	eventually pay out all of the foundation&rsquo;s assets as benefits to employees and former employees, no surplus is deemed to
	be recoverable by the Group. Similarly, unless the assets are insufficient to cover minimum benefits, the Group does not expect
	to make any deficit contribution to the foundation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	However, according to IFRS, the foundation
	has to be classified as a defined benefit plan due to underlying benefit guarantees and has to be accounted for on this basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The weighted average duration of the expected
	benefit payment is approximately 16.99 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Group expects to contribute CHF 139 thousand
	to this plan in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The principal assumptions underlying the measurement
	of the provision concerning the Swiss employees are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_107"></A>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">

</TD>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	54
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
